meanings.definition: Joking or jesting in a playful manner.
meanings.sent1: The jocosest clown at the circus always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: She had a jocosest attitude, always ready with a funny remark.
meanings.sent3: The jocosest puppy in the litter loved to play pranks on its siblings.
meanings.sent4: His jocosest nature shone through even in the most serious situations.
meanings.sent5: The jocosest student in class kept the mood light with their witty jokes.

meanings.sent1: Her jocosest remarks always brought smiles to people's faces.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's jocosest moments had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent3: The jocosest character in the movie had everyone chuckling at their clever lines.
meanings.sent4: His jocosest anecdotes added a touch of humor to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The jocosest writer in the group could turn even the dullest topic into something amusing.

meanings.sent1: The jocosest banter between friends lightened the mood instantly.
meanings.sent2: Their jocosest interactions always made for a fun time together.
meanings.sent3: The jocosest kitten in the litter loved to chase its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The jocosest painting in the gallery had visitors smiling as they passed by.
meanings.sent5: Her jocosest stories never failed to entertain both young and old listeners.
